title.narrative: IOM Air Border Data Systems Nigeria 2020-2022, engagement

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation

title.narrative: 1.1 Real-time data syncronization and nationa/international database consultation is ensured through the MIDAS platform and the NIS data architecture.

description.narrative:
- Number of international airports in Nigeria capable of real-time consultation with the INTERPOL SLTD (Stol and Lost Travel Documents) database and TDAWN (Travel Documents Associated with Notices) database through the NIS HQ.
- Relevant operational workflows and standard operation procedures (SOPs) are available.
- Irregular operational cases are effectively detected at target international airports.
- Number of training sessions (tailored for each aiport context) on operational workflows and SOPs related to international databases as well as on international good practices.
- Number of NIS officers and personnel of other relevant national agencies trained on operational workflows and SOPs related to international databases as well as on international good practices (disaggregated by gender).
- NUmber of airports which achieve improved/full MIDAS operational capacities and through having additional functionalities and installing additional equipment/infrastructure.
- Numbe

- Numbe

title.narrative: 2. Relevant government agencies in Nigeria conduct secondary inspection at international airports through a common investigative approach based on appropriate legal framework and strengthened inter-agency cooperation.

description.narrative:
- Number of international airports where secondary inspection mechanism for relevant national law enforcement agencies is operational.
- National Tas Force for secondary inspection mechanism is created by the GoN.
- Recommendations from the legal assessment are considered by the government for revising/creating relevant legislation.

title.narrative: 2. Relevant government agencies in Nigeria conduct secondary inspection at international airports through a common investigative approach based on appropriate legal framework and strengthened inter-agency cooperation.

description.narrative:
- Number of international airports where secondary inspection mechanism for relevant national law enforcement agencies is operational.
- National Tas Force for secondary inspection mechanism is created by the GoN.
- Recommendations from the legal assessment are considered by the government for revising/creating relevant legislation.

title.narrative: 2.1. Secondary inspection at international airports is operational through strengthened inter-agency cooperation in line with the overall border management strategy.

description.narrative:
- Number of national consultations for establishing secondary inspection at international airpots.
- Number of government agencies participating in each national consultation.
- Number of government officials participating in each national consultation (disaggregated by sex).
- A legal assessment conducted to define appropriate legal instruments which enables for multi-agency secondary inspection.
- Number of additional investigative tools available to national agencies (e.g. INTERPOL dashboard access).
etc.

title.narrative: 2.1. Secondary inspection at international airports is operational through strengthened inter-agency cooperation in line with the overall border management strategy.

description.narrative:
- Number of national consultations for establishing secondary inspection at international airpots.
- Number of government agencies participating in each national consultation.
- Number of government officials participating in each national consultation (disaggregated by sex).
- A legal assessment conducted to define appropriate legal instruments which enables for multi-agency secondary inspection.
- Number of additional investigative tools available to national agencies (e.g. INTERPOL dashboard access).
etc.

title.narrative: 1. The Government of Nigeria (GoN) facilitates faster, safer, and more reliable traveller processing at air borders through strengthened national data architecture, relevant legal framework and inter-agency cooperation.

description.narrative:
MIDAS platform and the overall data architecture is fully in place to allow the GoN to detect document fraud and consult with national and international lookout systems.
- API implementation roadmap agreed upon by relevant national agencies and consolidated with other existing partner organisations is endorsed by the GoN.
- Recommendations of the legal assessment are considered for revising/creating relevant legislation which enables API implementation in Nigera.

title.narrative: 1. The Government of Nigeria (GoN) facilitates faster, safer, and more reliable traveller processing at air borders through strengthened national data architecture, relevant legal framework and inter-agency cooperation.

description.narrative:
MIDAS platform and the overall data architecture is fully in place to allow the GoN to detect document fraud and consult with national and international lookout systems.
- API implementation roadmap agreed upon by relevant national agencies and consolidated with other existing partner organisations is endorsed by the GoN.
- Recommendations of the legal assessment are considered for revising/creating relevant legislation which enables API implementation in Nigera.

title.narrative: 1.2 Relevant national agencies in Nigeria are fully aware of the existing international standards and recommended practices related to (API) and the national API implementation roadmap based on legal and technical recommendations is available.

description.narrative:
Number of national workshops focused on API implementation conducted in cooperation with UN/international partner organisations.
- Number of government agencies participating in each API workshop.
- Number of government officials participating in each API workshop (disaggregated by gender).
- A legal assessment report is available with the existing legislative gap analysis and recommendations.
- A technical assessment report is available with gap analysis and recommendations.
- Number of study visits conducted to API advanced countries.
- Number of government officials participating in each study visit (disaggregated by gender).
- A National API implementation roadmap consolidated with other exisiting partner organisations is available.

- A National API implementation roadmap consolidated with other exisiting partner organisations is available.
